Class Poised

java.lang.Object
Poised
public class Poised extends Object
Represents a project management application that interacts with a MySQL database using JDBC. Allows users to perform various tasks related to project management.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Poised()
    Default constructor for the Poised class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Poised

      public Poised()
      Default constructor for the Poised class. This constructor is automatically invoked when an object of the class is created. It initializes the Poised object.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the program. This method establishes a connection to the MySQL database, creates necessary tables, and displays the main menu for user interaction.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments (not used in this program).

    • displayMenu

      public static void displayMenu(Connection connection)
      Shows the option to choose from.
      Parameters:
      connection - to connect to the database.

    • createTables

      public static void createTables(Connection connection)
      Creates the necessary tables in the database for project management. This includes the main projects table, as well as tables for architect, contractor, customer, and project manager information.
      Parameters:
      connection - The database connection used for table creation.

    • createTable

      public static void createTable(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Creates the main projects table in the database. The table includes fields such as project number, project name, building type, address, ERF number, total fee, total paid, deadline, architect ID, contractor ID, customer ID, project manager ID, status, and date of completion.
      Parameters:
      connection - The database connection used for table creation.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL exception occurs during table creation.

    • createArchitectTable

      public static void createArchitectTable(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Creates the 'architect' table in the MySQL database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • createContractorTable

      public static void createContractorTable(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Creates the 'contractor' table in the MySQL database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • createCustomerTable

      public static void createCustomerTable(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Creates the 'customer' table in the MySQL database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • createProjectManagerTable

      public static void createProjectManagerTable(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      Creates the 'project_manager' table in the MySQL database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs.

    • parseDate

      public static Date parseDate(String dateString)
      Parses a date string into a Date object.
      Parameters:
      dateString - The date string to parse.
      Returns:
      The parsed Date object.

    • captureInformationByUser

      public static void captureInformationByUser(Connection connection)
      Captures project information entered by the user and stores it in the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.

    • getCustomerSurname

      public static String getCustomerSurname(Connection connection, int customer_id)
      Captures customer surname.
      Parameters:
      connection - The JDBC Connection to the MySQL database.
      customer_id - customer_id

    • captureInformation

      public static void captureInformation(Connection connection, int project_number, String project_name, String building_type, String address, String erf_number, double total_fee, double total_paid, Date deadline, boolean isFinalized, int architect_id, int contractor_id, int customer_id, int manager_id)
      Captures project information and inserts it into the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection.
      project_number - Unique identifier for the project.
      project_name - Name of the project.
      building_type - Type of building for the project.
      address - Address of the project.
      erf_number - ERF number of the project.
      total_fee - Total fee for the project.
      total_paid - Total amount paid for the project.
      deadline - Deadline for the project.
      isFinalized - Boolean indicating whether the project is finalized.
      contractor_id - Int id for the contractor
      architect_id - Int id for the architect
      customer_id - Int id for the customer
      manager_id - Int id for the manager

    • captureArchitectInformation

      public static void captureArchitectInformation(Connection connection, int architect_id, String name, String phone, String email, String address)
      Captures architect information and associates it with a project.
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection.
      architect_id - Unique identifier for the architect.
      name - Name of the architect.
      phone - Phone number of the architect.
      email - Email address of the architect.
      address - Address of the architect.

    • captureContractorInformation

    • updateProjectInformation

      public static void updateProjectInformation(Connection connection, int projectNumber, String projectName, String buildingType, String address, String erfNumber, Double totalFee, Double totalPaid, Date deadline, Integer architectId, Integer contractorId, Integer customerId, Integer managerId, boolean isFinalized)
      Updates project information in the database.
      Parameters:
      connection - Database connection.
      projectNumber - Project number to update.
      projectName - Updated project name.
      buildingType - Updated building type.
      address - Updated project address.
      erfNumber - Updated ERF number.
      totalFee - Updated total fee.
      totalPaid - Updated total amount paid.
      deadline - Updated project deadline.
      architectId - Updated architect ID.
      contractorId - Updated contractor ID.
      customerId - Updated customer ID.
      managerId - Updated project manager ID.
